citations: Based on General Motors Bay City, Michigan plant achieving 11.5% energy intensity reduction and Bell's Brewery in Comstock, Michigan achieving 10.35% reduction through ENERGY STAR programs. Chrome Deposit Corporation achieved 12% natural gas reduction through boiler optimization and leak repairs.

Following Cleveland-Cliffs Steel Corporation's model in Middletown, Ohio, installing electric melting furnaces and hydrogen-ready direct reduced iron (DRI) plant. American steel sector has demonstrated significant energy intensity reductions through electric arc furnace adoption.

Based on successful Illinois implementations including Thelen Sand & Gravel's 2-megawatt ground-mounted system and Minnesota's RMS Company's 968 kWdc rooftop system providing 50% facility power. Complement with utility green tariff programs similar to General Motors' Michigan facilities achieving 100% wind power matching.
